author: cnbc.com
title: Salesforce.com: Fiscal 1Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) _ Salesforce.com Inc. (CRM) on Tuesday reported fiscal first-quarter net income of $344 million, after reporting a loss in the same period a year earlier.
The San Francisco-based company said it had net income of 46 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 74 cents per share.
The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 18 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 46 cents per share.
The customer-management software developer posted revenue of $3.01 billion in the period, which also topped Street forecasts. Fourteen analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $2.94 billion.
For the current quarter ending in August, Salesforce.com expects its per-share earnings to range from 46 cents to 47 cents.
The company said it expects revenue in the range of $3.22 billion to $3.23 billion for the fiscal second quarter. Analysts surveyed by Zacks had expected revenue of $3.1 billion.
Salesforce.com expects full-year earnings in the range of $2.29 to $2.31 per share, with revenue ranging from $13.08 billion to $13.13 billion.
Salesforce.com shares have increased 24 percent since the beginning of the year, while the Standard & Poor's 500 index has increased roughly 1 percent. In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, shares hit $126.92, an increase of 40 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on CRM at https://www.zacks.com/ap/CRM
